Events that occurred on 12 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1915 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes "A Song of Aryador".
1931 - Actor Ian Holm is born.
1951 - Third day of the Congrès Internationale de Philologie Moderne at the University of Liège, a conference in which J.R.R. Tolkien delivers the paper "Middle English 'Losenger'".
1960 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 224.
1965 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letters 276 and 277.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rose MacNamara.
1981 - Author and librarian William Ready dies.
2010 - Bulgarian Tolkien Society's 6th Tolkien-Fest in Sofia.
2012 - An updated edition of Charles Dixon and David T. Wenzel's The Hobbit is published.
2013 - The Hobbit, illustrated by Jemima Catlin, is published.
2013 - Tolkien Calendar 2014 is published.
2014 - Oxonmoot 2014 at Lady Margaret Hall.
2014 - Tolkien at Exeter College: How an Oxford undergraduate created Middle-earth by John Garth is published.
2015 - Oxonmoot 2015 at St Antony's College.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
